auth_token.description: ArgoCD authentication token, takes precedence over `username`/`password`. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_AUTH_TOKEN` environment variable.

cert_file.description: Additional root CA certificates file to add to the client TLS connection pool.

config_path.description: Override the default config path of `$HOME/.config/argocd/config`. Only relevant when `use_local_config`. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_CONFIG_PATH` environment variable.

context.description: Kubernetes context to load from an existing `.kube/config` file. Can be set through `ARGOCD_CONTEXT` environment variable.

grpc_web.description: Whether to use gRPC web proxy client. Useful if Argo CD server is behind proxy which does not support HTTP2.

grpc_web_root_path.description: Use the gRPC web proxy client and set the web root, e.g. `argo-cd`. Useful if the Argo CD server is behind a proxy at a non-root path.

headers.description: Additional headers to add to each request to the ArgoCD server.

insecure.description: Whether to skip TLS server certificate. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_INSECURE` environment variable.

password.description: Authentication password. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_AUTH_PASSWORD` environment variable.

plain_text.description: Whether to initiate an unencrypted connection to ArgoCD server.

server_addr.description: ArgoCD server address with port. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_SERVER` environment variable.

use_local_config.description: Use the authentication settings found in the local config file. Useful when you have previously logged in using SSO. Conflicts with `auth_token`, `username` and `password`.

username.description: Authentication username. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_AUTH_USERNAME` environment variable.

client_certificate.description: PEM-encoded client certificate for TLS authentication. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CLIENT_CERT_DATA`.

client_key.description: PEM-encoded client certificate key for TLS authentication. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CLIENT_KEY_DATA`.

cluster_ca_certificate.description: PEM-encoded root certificates bundle for TLS authentication. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CLUSTER_CA_CERT_DATA`.

config_context.description: Context to choose from the config file. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CTX`.

config_path.description: Path to the kube config file. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CONFIG_PATH`.

config_paths.description: A list of paths to the kube config files. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CONFIG_PATHS`.

host.description: The hostname (in form of URI) of the Kubernetes API. Can be sourced from `KUBE_HOST`.

insecure.description: Whether server should be accessed without verifying the TLS certificate. Can be sourced from `KUBE_INSECURE`.

password.description: The password to use for HTTP basic authentication when accessing the Kubernetes API. Can be sourced from `KUBE_PASSWORD`.

token.description: Token to authenticate an service account. Can be sourced from `KUBE_TOKEN`.

username.description: The username to use for HTTP basic authentication when accessing the Kubernetes API. Can be sourced from `KUBE_USER`.

api_version.description: API version to use when decoding the ExecCredentials resource, e.g. `client.authentication.k8s.io/v1beta1`.

args.description: Map of environment variables to set when executing the plugin.

env.description: List of arguments to pass when executing the plugin.

block.description: Configuration block to use an [exec-based credential plugin](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/authentication/#client-go-credential-plugins), e.g. call an external command to receive user credentials.
Kubernetes configuration.

cascade.description: Whether to applying cascading deletion when application is removed.

wait.description: Upon application creation or update, wait for application health/sync status to be healthy/Synced, upon application deletion, wait for application to be removed, when set to true. Wait timeouts are controlled by Terraform Create, Update and Delete resource timeouts (all default to 5 minutes).

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the applications.argoproj.io that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

generation.description: A sequence number representing a specific generation of the desired state.

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the applications.argoproj.io. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

name.description: Name of the applications.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

namespace.description: Namespace of the applications.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

resource_version.description: An opaque value that represents the internal version of this applications.argoproj.io that can be used by clients to determine when applications.argoproj.io has changed. Read more: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency

uid.description: The unique in time and space value for this applications.argoproj.io. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#uids

block.description: Standard Kubernetes object metadata. For more info see the [Kubernetes reference](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata).

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

revision_history_limit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

name.description: Name of the target cluster. Can be used instead of `server`.

namespace.description: Target namespace for the application's resources. The namespace will only be set for namespace-scoped resources that have not set a value for .metadata.namespace.

server.description: URL of the target cluster and must be set to the Kubernetes control plane API.

block.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

group.description: The Kubernetes resource Group to match for.

jq_path_expressions.description: List of JQ path expression strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

json_pointers.description: List of JSONPaths strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

kind.description: The Kubernetes resource Kind to match for.

name.description: The Kubernetes resource Name to match for.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes resource Namespace to match for.

block.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.
List of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application.

chart.description: Helm chart name. Must be specified for applications sourced from a Helm repo.

path.description: Directory path within the repository. Only valid for applications sourced from Git.

repo_url.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

target_revision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

recurse.description: Whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

block.description: List of Jsonnet External Variables.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

block.description: List of Jsonnet Top-level Arguments
Jsonnet specific options.
Path/directory specific options.

release_name.description: Helm release name. If omitted it will use the application name.

skip_crds.description: Whether to skip custom resource definition installation step (Helm's [--skip-crds](https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/custom_resource_definitions/)).

value_files.description: List of Helm value files to use when generating a template.

values.description: Helm values to be passed to helm template, typically defined as a block.

force_string.description: Determines whether to tell Helm to interpret booleans and numbers as strings.

block.description: Helm parameters which are passed to the helm template command upon manifest generation.
Helm specific options.

common_annotations.description: List of additional annotations to add to rendered manifests.

common_labels.description: List of additional labels to add to rendered manifests.

images.description: List of Kustomize image override specifications.

name_prefix.description: Prefix appended to resources for Kustomize apps.

name_suffix.description: Suffix appended to resources for Kustomize apps.

version.description: Version of Kustomize to use for rendering manifests.

block.description: Kustomize specific options.

name.description: Name of the plugin. Only set the plugin name if the plugin is defined in `argocd-cm`. If the plugin is defined as a sidecar, omit the name. The plugin will be automatically matched with the Application according to the plugin's discovery rules.

block.description: Environment variables passed to the plugin.
Config management plugin specific options.
Location of the application's manifests or chart.

sync_options.description: List of sync options. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/sync-options/.

allow_empty.description: Allows apps have zero live resources.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

self_heal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

block.description: Whether to automatically keep an application synced to the target revision.

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

max_duration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

block.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.
Controls failed sync retry behavior.
Controls when and how a sync will be performed.
The application specification.
Manages [applications](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/declarative-setup/#applications) within ArgoCD.

info.description: Information about cluster cache and state.

name.description: Name of the cluster. If omitted, will use the server address.

namespaces.description: List of namespaces which are accessible in that cluster. Cluster level resources would be ignored if namespace list is not empty.

project.description: Reference between project and cluster that allow you automatically to be added as item inside Destinations project entity. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/projects/#project-scoped-repositories-and-clusters.

server.description: Server is the API server URL of the Kubernetes cluster.

shard.description: Optional shard number. Calculated on the fly by the application controller if not specified.

bearer_token.description: Server requires Bearer authentication. The client will not attempt to use refresh tokens for an OAuth2 flow.

password.description: Password for servers that require Basic authentication.

username.description: Username for servers that require Basic authentication.

role_arn.description: IAM role ARN. If set then AWS IAM Authenticator assume a role to perform cluster operations instead of the default AWS credential provider chain.

api_version.description: Preferred input version of the ExecInfo

args.description: Arguments to pass to the command when executing it

env.description: Env defines additional environment variables to expose to the process. Passed as a map of strings

install_hint.description: This text is shown to the user when the executable doesn't seem to be present

block.description: Configuration for an exec provider used to call an external command to perform cluster authentication See: https://godoc.org/k8s.io/client-go/tools/clientcmd/api#ExecConfig.

ca_data.description: PEM-encoded bytes (typically read from a root certificates bundle).

cert_data.description: PEM-encoded bytes (typically read from a client certificate file).

insecure.description: Whether server should be accessed without verifying the TLS certificate.

key_data.description: PEM-encoded bytes (typically read from a client certificate key file).

server_name.description: Name to pass to the server for SNI and used in the client to check server certificates against. If empty, the hostname used to contact the server is used.

block.description: Settings to enable transport layer security when connecting to the cluster.
Cluster information for connecting to a cluster.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the cluster secret that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the cluster secret. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

block.description: Standard cluster secret's metadata. More info: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata
Manages [clusters](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/declarative-setup/#clusters) within ArgoCD.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the appprojects.argoproj.io that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

generation.description: A sequence number representing a specific generation of the desired state.

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the appprojects.argoproj.io. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

name.description: Name of the appprojects.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

namespace.description: Namespace of the appprojects.argoproj.io, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

resource_version.description: An opaque value that represents the internal version of this appprojects.argoproj.io that can be used by clients to determine when appprojects.argoproj.io has changed. Read more: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency

uid.description: The unique in time and space value for this appprojects.argoproj.io. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#uids

block.description: Standard Kubernetes object metadata. For more info see the [Kubernetes reference](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata).

signature_keys.description: List of PGP key IDs that commits in Git must be signed with in order to be allowed for sync.

source_namespaces.description: List of namespaces that application resources are allowed to be created in.

source_repos.description: List of repository URLs which can be used for deployment. Can be set to `["*"]` to allow all configured repositories configured in ArgoCD.

group.description: The Kubernetes resource Group to match for.

kind.description: The Kubernetes resource Kind to match for.

block.description: Blacklisted cluster level resources.

group.description: The Kubernetes resource Group to match for.

kind.description: The Kubernetes resource Kind to match for.

block.description: Whitelisted cluster level resources.

name.description: Name of the destination cluster which can be used instead of server.

server.description: URL of the target cluster and must be set to the Kubernetes control plane API.

block.description: Destinations available for deployment.

group.description: The Kubernetes resource Group to match for.

kind.description: The Kubernetes resource Kind to match for.

block.description: Blacklisted namespace level resources.

group.description: The Kubernetes resource Group to match for.

kind.description: The Kubernetes resource Kind to match for.

block.description: Whitelisted namespace level resources.

warn.description: Whether a warning condition should be created for apps which have orphaned resources.

group.description: The Kubernetes resource Group to match for.

kind.description: The Kubernetes resource Kind to match for.

name.description: The Kubernetes resource name to match for.

block.description: Settings specifying if controller should monitor orphaned resources of apps in this project.

groups.description: List of OIDC group claims bound to this role.

policies.description: List of casbin formatted strings that define access policies for the role in the project. For more information, see the [ArgoCD RBAC reference](https://argoproj.github.io/argo-cd/operator-manual/rbac/#rbac-permission-structure).

block.description: User defined RBAC roles associated with this project.

applications.description: List of applications that the window will apply to.

clusters.description: List of clusters that the window will apply to.

duration.description: Amount of time the sync window will be open.

kind.description: Defines if the window allows or blocks syncs, allowed values are `allow` or `deny`.

manual_sync.description: Enables manual syncs when they would otherwise be blocked.

namespaces.description: List of namespaces that the window will apply to.

schedule.description: Time the window will begin, specified in cron format.

block.description: Settings controlling when syncs can be run for apps in this project.
ArgoCD AppProject spec.
Manages [projects](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/projects/) within ArgoCD.

expires_at.description: If `expires_in` is set, Unix timestamp upon which the token will expire.

expires_in.description: Duration before the token will expire. Valid time units are `ns`, `us` (or `s`), `ms`, `s`, `m`, `h`. E.g. `12h`, `7d`. Default: No expiration.

issued_at.description: Unix timestamp at which the token was issued.

project.description: The project associated with the token.

renew_before.description: Duration to control token silent regeneration, valid time units are `ns`, `us` (or `s`), `ms`, `s`, `m`, `h`. If `expires_in` is set, Terraform will regenerate the token if `expires_in - renew_before < currentDate`.

role.description: The name of the role in the project associated with the token.

block.description: Manages ArgoCD project role JWT tokens. See [Project Roles](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/projects/#project-roles) for more info.

connection_state_status.description: Contains information about the current state of connection to the repository server.

enable_lfs.description: Whether `git-lfs` support should be enabled for this repository.

enable_oci.description: Whether `helm-oci` support should be enabled for this repository.

githubapp_enterprise_base_url.description: GitHub API URL for GitHub app authentication.

githubapp_id.description: ID of the GitHub app used to access the repo.

githubapp_installation_id.description: The installation ID of the GitHub App used to access the repo.

githubapp_private_key.description: Private key data (PEM) for authentication via GitHub app.

inherited_creds.description: Whether credentials were inherited from a credential set.

insecure.description: Whether the connection to the repository ignores any errors when verifying TLS certificates or SSH host keys.

name.description: Name to be used for this repo. Only used with Helm repos.

password.description: Password or PAT used for authenticating at the remote repository.

project.description: The project name, in case the repository is project scoped.

ssh_private_key.description: PEM data for authenticating at the repo server. Only used with Git repos.

tls_client_cert_data.description: TLS client certificate in PEM format for authenticating at the repo server.

tls_client_cert_key.description: TLS client certificate private key in PEM format for authenticating at the repo server.

type.description: Type of the repo. Can be either `git` or `helm`. `git` is assumed if empty or absent.

username.description: Username used for authenticating at the remote repository.

block.description: Manages [repositories](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/operator-manual/declarative-setup/#repositories) within ArgoCD.

cert_data.description: The actual certificate data, dependent on the certificate type.

cert_info.description: Additional certificate info, dependent on the certificate type (e.g. SSH fingerprint, X509 CommonName).

cert_subtype.description: The sub type of the cert, i.e. `ssh-rsa`.

server_name.description: DNS name of the server this certificate is intended for.

block.description: Defines a `https` certificate.

cert_data.description: The actual certificate data, dependent on the certificate type.

cert_info.description: Additional certificate info, dependent on the certificate type (e.g. SSH fingerprint, X509 CommonName).

cert_subtype.description: The sub type of the cert, i.e. `ssh-rsa`.

server_name.description: DNS name of the server this certificate is intended for.

block.description: Defines a `ssh` certificate.
Manages [custom TLS certificates](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/private-repositories/#self-signed-untrusted-tls-certificates) used by ArgoCD for connecting Git repositories.

enable_oci.description: Whether `helm-oci` support should be enabled for this repo.

githubapp_enterprise_base_url.description: GitHub API URL for GitHub app authentication.

githubapp_id.description: Github App ID of the app used to access the repo for GitHub app authentication.

githubapp_installation_id.description: ID of the installed GitHub App for GitHub app authentication.

githubapp_private_key.description: Private key data (PEM) for authentication via GitHub app.

password.description: Password for authenticating at the repo server.

ssh_private_key.description: Private key data for authenticating at the repo server using SSH (only Git repos).

tls_client_cert_data.description: TLS client cert data for authenticating at the repo server.

tls_client_cert_key.description: TLS client cert key for authenticating at the repo server.

url.description: URL that these credentials matches to.

username.description: Username for authenticating at the repo server.

block.description:
Manages [repository credentials](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/private-repositories/#credentials) within ArgoCD.

**Note**: due to restrictions in the ArgoCD API the provider is unable to track drift in this resource to fields other than `username`. I.e. the provider is unable to detect changes to repository credentials that are made outside of Terraform (e.g. manual updates to the underlying Kubernetes Secrets).
